Posted in Food & Drink Detroit‚Äôs long-standing Dakota Inn Rathskeller is under new ownership The nearly century-old German beer hall is now owned by Paddy Lynch, who also owns The Schvitz, Convent Detroit, and Dutch Girl Donuts by Lee DeVito June 6, 2025 August 9, 2025 Share this: Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Email Click to share on Reddit (Opens in new window) Reddit Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Click to share on Nextdoor (Opens in new window) Nextdoor Click to share on Bluesky (Opens in new window) Bluesky Have something to share? SEND US A NEWS TIP The Dakota Inn Rathskeller. Credit: Courtesy photo The Dakota Inn Rathskeller, a nearly century-old German style restaurant and beer hall in Detroit that has been owned by the Kurz family since 1933, has a new owner. The restaurant is now owned by Paddy Lynch, a funeral director-turned-developer who has also acquired The Schvitz, Convent Detroit, and Dutch Girl Donuts in recent years. According to a press release, Lynch has tapped Les Molnar of popular restaurants Johnny Noodle King and Green Dot Stables to serve as culinary director, and Jarred Gild of The Schvitz and the Pash & Glou wine store in Rochesterwine store as beverage director and special programs manager. In the release, Lynch said that ‚Äúlittle to nothing will change in the Dakota Inn‚Äôs main dining room,‚Äù but plans to breath life into the underutilized downstairs Rathskeller bar room with private parties, wine tastings, and other events. [content-1] ‚ÄúI‚Äôve loved the wines of Germany and Central Europe for years and local wine drinkers have shown they do too,‚Äù Gild said in a statement. ‚ÄúThis will be the best place to explore the diverse styles of the region, from centuries old traditional estates all the way to the hippest natural wine upstarts. There is going to be something for everyone here, and so many cool wines that you can hang out with us every week. Being a regular here is going to be really rewarding.‚Äù The new owners say they also want to better utilize the Dakota Inn‚Äôs backyard for a year-round biergarten. Other plans include a gift shop, a specialty market, and ‚Äúeven overnight accommodations in the vintage apartments upstairs.‚Äù [content-2] While the Dakota Inn typically closed in July, the new owners say they want to keep the backyard biergarten open all summer and reopen the dining room for an anniversary party in the first week of August. The Dakota Inn is located at 17324 John R St, Detroit. Operating hours are 4-11 p.m. Thursday-Saturday, with plans to expand hours in the fall. The Dakota Inn Rathskeller 17324 John R St., Detroit, MI (313) 867-9722 website This article appears in Jun 25 ‚Äì Jul 1, 2025 . Related Have something to share? SEND US A NEWS TIP Featured Local Savings Tagged: Apple News , Green Dot Stables , Home Feature Follows , Johnny Noodle King , Paddy Lynch , Section Feature , The Dakota Inn Rathskeller , The Schvitz Lee DeVito Leyland ‚ÄúLee‚Äù DeVito is the editor in chief of Detroit Metro Times since 2016. His writing has also been published in CREEM, VICE, In These Times, and New City. He once asked porn star Stormy Daniels... More by Lee DeVito Leave a comment Cancel reply You must be logged in to post a comment. About us - Rathskellers +30 2310 604 260 Ethnikis Antistaseos 143, 551 34, Thessaloniki, Greece Registered VAT: EL801779511 1 My Account Our Gaming Tables The Councilor The Phalanx The Hive The Garrison The Altar The Sunnygeeks Photo Galleries Information Ordering Process Frequently Asked Questions About us Gaming Labs Testimonials Contact Shop BUY NOW BUY NOW My Account 1 Our Gaming Tables The Councilor The Phalanx The Hive The Garrison The Altar The Sunnygeeks Photo Galleries Information Ordering Process Frequently Asked Questions About us Gaming Labs Testimonials Contact Shop For the full experience, please visit our website from a PC. Hi! We are Rathskellers A family-run business that believes gaming is best enjoyed with good friends and a great table. Established in 2013 A SPIN-OFF OF A 60-YEAR-OLD GREEK FAMILY FURNITURE BUSINESS We design & manufacture heirloom pieces of gaming furniture. Everything is handcrafted with love You won‚Äôt see much in the way of computerized or automated processes inside our workshop. Family Business We are a small and dedicated shop of 27 people Paschalis (Co-Founder) working with wood From Idea to reality, here are some of the stuff we've introduced to the industry. Aluminum Railing System Our first innovative solution to damaged wood rails. Dividable Gaming Zones Unique colored lighting "zones". USB Charging & Wireless Charging You table can have enough juice for all players. Spring Loaded Leaves Wood has the tendency to shrink & expand. That is why all of our tables feature our innovative spring loaded mechanism allowing you to tweak as desired. Heavy Duty Storage Drawers Now you can store all of your table leaves inside the drawers. Soft Closing Drawers Our drawers are built using high-end mechanisms from Germany. Buttery Smooth, with that satisfying *wow* factor. Simonis Speed Cloth Yes, we bring high-end cloths available only in Billiard Tournaments into your table. Seamless Lighting & Zones Controllable lighting with zones (for each player) via app. Each LED is addressable, changing colors with animation effects. Bluetooth Sound System With NFC pairing & Bluetooth multipoint (2 Bluetooth sources simultaneously). Water Resistant Cellar & Cloths With rubberized leaves and water-resistant velveteen, the accidental spills of that aged wine are nothing to worry about. OUR WORKSHOP You can trust us. We're Family! You won‚Äôt see much in the way of computerized or automated processes inside our workshop. All of our tables are lovingly crafted by our bare hands. Even our coloring process is done by hand. We are a small and dedicated shop of twenty seven people: brothers, designers, woodworkers, engineers‚Ä¶gamers. We have been manufacturing furniture for more than 50 years, and we pour that accumulated talent, expertise, and excellence into all our products. You can trust us ‚Äì we‚Äôre family. QUALITY Thanos (Co-Founder) proud of Quality   Accomplishments We do not compromise We have tried very hard to keep the cost of our tables affordable and accessible, but we do not compromise in quality. With a Rathskellers table you will still be able to play your favorite board games 30 to 40 years from now. Our unique real wood veneer over solid wood oak boards manufacturing process is used so that it can withstand the test of time. Our innovative aluminum rail system is guaranteed to withstand even the most frustrated dice rolls. If you never have enough wheat, don‚Äôt worry! Your table can take the hit. OUR VALUES Creating the ultimate gaming table We started manufacturing tailor-made tables for board gamers in 2013 after spending 18 months prototyping each and every bit of our tables. We combined our love for board games and our experience manufacturing quality furniture to create the Ultimate Board Game Table. Like you, we are passionate about our gaming experiences. We own more than 500 board games and have a dedicated playroom for our board game nights. THE MAKERS Rathskellers was founded in 2013 by the two Milios brothers, Thanos and Paschalis, as an extension of a family-owned furniture business that is now in its third generation. Spending our summer vacations playing Space Crusade & Heroquest while still aiming for that boom shakalaka in our dusty NBA JAM SNES cartridge. Milios Thanos Branding and Marketing Co-Founder Coordinates the many business details of running Rathskellers. He loves design and marketing, but has also used his programming knowledge to publish a variety of apps and games. A lover of Euro games and RPG. His favorite game is Castles of Burgundy. (Although his name is Thanos, he is not the Marvel Super Villain). Milios Paschalis Furniture Design Co-Founder He is the master craftsman of Rathskellers. A wizard with his hands who takes the time to build every detail to perfection. As a fan of abstract and war games, he would suggest a deeper Cellar and Simonis speed cloth ‚Äì just the right combination for laying down Hanabi cards or pushing around trays of orcs. Milios Stergios Furniture Design Advisor A second-generation expert infurniture manufacturing. As the father of Thanos and Paschalis, and also the owner of Emil, the family‚Äôs luxury kitchen and furniture design company, he guides the younger generation through the process offering improvements, and solutions to the many unique challenges of designing specialized gaming furniture. Manufacturing furniture for over 50 years, his expertise is unparalleled. ONE TREE PLANTED Starting from 2022, we plan on planting one olive tree  in Kalamata (Greece) with each order on behalf of our customers. Each tree will be named by their family name with a date of birth (order date). Maybe one day you will be able and visit our olive harvest and enjoy that pure & extra Greek virgin olive oil from your tree... Handcrafted with ‚ù§Ô∏è from Gamers Like you We have been manufacturing furniture for more than 60 years, and we build that accumulated talent, expertise, and excellence into all our products. You can trust us ‚Äì we‚Äôre family. PRODUCTION DIARY TO THE FUTURE Founded  - 1958 In a small Greek Village of Pella, Greece. Cabinet making and handcrafted decorative products. Gaming Tables - 2013 Started making tables. Attending our first Spiel (Essen Convention). A great success. Today Introducing new things to the market. Successfully launching a crowdfunding campaign raising over 1.5mil ‚Ç¨ The Future With your trust & support we will keep innovating and enhancing your gaming lives for years to come. Reservations Reservation Information Rathskeller Advisory Board (RAB) Employment Application About Us Menu Events Reservations Employment Home Events and Reservations A A A Events and Reservations Events The Rathskeller Advisory Board plans and hosts free weekly events for students including Trivia Tuesdays, DJ Fridays, and other specialty events each month including football watch parties, make-and-take events, interactive classes, variety shows, and more. Reservations The Rathskeller is available for use by all registered student organizations. To schedule an event at the Rathskeller, an organization/department must submit a Special Event Request Form to the Rathskeller Advisory Board (RAB) at least 3 weeks (21 days) prior to the date of the event. The use of the Rathskeller by individuals for special events is not permitted, though it can be arranged for private rental by contacting the Director at 305-284-6310 or email at ratres@miami.edu . Staff Resources Professional Staff Staff Development A A A Staff Development You are invited to join us for our lunch and learn series Monday, March 24 from noon-1 p.m. in the Shalala Student Center, Senate Room (3rd Floor). Morgan Anderson, Assistant Director, Independent Learning Initiative (ILI), and team will discuss Supporting All Types of Learners: A Training from the Camner Center on Disability, Inclusion, and Accessibility. This will be an engaging and lively presentation filled with important information to consider for implementation across functional areas. To prepare for this presentation, we have two pre-reading articles that may be helpful to be fully present in the session. Access the articles Upcoming Professional Development Activities: Monday, March 24 | Noon-1 p.m. | Supporting All Types of Learners: A Training from the Camner Center on Disability, Inclusion, and Accessibility with Morgan Anderson, Assistant Director, Independent Learning Initiative (ILI), and team. Thursday, May 1 | 8:30-10:00 a.m. | Laurel Awards Breakfast (Nominations are due on Wednesday, March 19 at 11:59 p.m. via Qualtrics ). Coral Gables, legendary roadhouse turned restaurant, reveals an early 1960s mural. News Sports High Schools Life Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals JUDY PUTNAM Putnam: Can you identify these folks who were captured on a 1960s Coral Gables mural? Judy Putnam Lansing State Journal EAST LANSING ‚Äì The longtime owners of a family-run restaurant unearthed a time capsule of sorts this summer. It‚Äôs a mural painted more than a half-century ago that for¬†years was hidden behind a wall. A recent renovation uncovered the 33-foot painting at Coral Gables. The collage, which is in good shape,¬†holds nearly 100 images, both portraits and caricatures. It appears to be a who‚Äôs-who of people who circulated in East Lansing and customers of Coral Gables, a former roadhouse and dance hall on Grand River Avenue that‚Äôs now a restaurant and banquet facility. The owners want help identifying the faces they believe were painted in the early 1960s. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. They‚Äôre hoping¬†longtime Spartans in town for home football games this fall will stop in and give them a hand identifying people depicted. The mural, in the back of the building in a hall behind a meeting room, will stay put as the restaurant, which dates back to 1929, works to connect customers to the area‚Äôs past. ‚ÄúWe are living history,‚Äù said Stuart Vanis, general manager of the restaurant. His dad and uncle bought the place in 1968. Coral Gables was strategically located just outside East Lansing city limits, in Meridian Twp., to serve students alcohol as the city was dry until 1968. Among the famous musicians playing there was Tommy Dorsey and his orchestra, Duke Ellington and Woody Herman. Chubby Checker played there in 1970. More: From the Archives: Restaurants that have survived and thrived The faces on the mural are not the type of folks who would have populated the ‚ÄúAnimal House‚Äù style fraternity in the early 1960s. They‚Äôre more the clean-cut, shirt-and-tie guys, plus a few women in ‚Äò60s bouffant hairdos and a few athletes in uniform. There‚Äôs legendary Spartan football Coach Clarence ‚ÄúBiggie‚Äù Munn, who was MSU's athletic director from 1953 to 1971, and a caricature of John Hannah, president of Michigan State University from 1941 to 1969, looking like a mob boss. And then there‚Äôs Gruff Sparty, an early version of the MSU's¬†mascot. Today‚Äôs Sparty looks a lot more friendly. Former Gov. Jim Blanchard is thought to be among the crowd in the mural. Vanis, who runs the restaurant with his cousin, Anastasia Kimbouris, said customers have already started to identify the people. They said they plan to start capturing the names. Related: Michigan State students are drinking less. No really. Their fathers, Alex Vanis, 85, and George Tesseris, 86, bought the business in 1968. The pair are brothers-in-law. The mural was visible when they bought it, located on the path to the bathrooms from the ‚Äúshow bar.‚Äù It was thought to be dated and was covered up during a long-ago renovation in the late ‚Äò70s. No one quite remembers when. Stuart Vanis, born in 1977, said he doesn‚Äôt recall it as a kid at all. As the years passed, the mural wasn‚Äôt completely forgotten but ‚Äúwe didn‚Äôt know the condition of it,‚Äù Kimbouris, 44, said. As workmen pulled away drywall and brick covering to widen the hallway, it revealed the mural in still vibrant colors. It's¬†unsigned but¬†two other murals were located in the former¬†basement-level Rathskeller were signed by John Lundstrum, an art student at MSU. It¬†could be the same handiwork. The painting will stay. Lots of Spartans and area residents worked at Coral Gables or met their spouses at the bar.¬†The family wants to remind customers of its long ties to the area. ‚ÄúOne of our goals is to let people know we are a place that‚Äôs been here forever,‚Äù Kimbouris said. The restaurant is located at ¬†2838 E Grand River Ave, East Lansing. If you can identify a face, stop by or call (517) 337-1311. Judy Putnam is a columnist with the Lansing State Journal. Contact her at (517) 267-1304 or at jputnam@lsj.com . Rathskeller Advisory Board (RAB) Policies Rathskeller Memory Bricks The Rathskeller Advisory Board (RAB) is the student programming committee for Hurricane Productions. RAB organizes and hosts free weekly events for students, such as Trivia Tuesdays, Karaoke Wednesdays, DJ Thursdays, and various specialty events. These include football and basketball watch parties, a comedy show in the Spring semester, and more. Get Involved: RAB meets every Monday at 8 p.m. during the academic year in the Activities Rooms on the third floor of the Shalala Student Center. All students are welcome to join! Chair: Adriana Alvarado ( axa3277@miami.edu ) Advisor: Francine Coker ( fcoker@miami.edu ) Facebook: facebook.com/UMRathskeller Instagram: @umrathskeller Twitter: @UMRathskeller Event Reservations RAB welcomes collaborative partnerships and events with students organizations who want to host their event at the Rathskeller. If a student organization wishes to use the Ratskeller for an event (must be free and open to all students on campus), please submit a reservation request to RAB.
